tier.item: That generic nouns may be regarded as identifiable can be proved by the fact that they may be
anaphorically referred to by a definite pronoun. For example, A book is a useful thing to have in a doctor's
waiting room. It is also something easy to carry around (Lambrecht 1994:82).
Other studies divide the generic into `definite generic' and `indefinite generic' (e.g. Carlson and
